results.adx_keywords: Bacteria;Coccidioidomycosis (Valley Fever);Centers for Disease Control and Prevention;Far East, South and Southeast Asia and Pacific Areas;Gulf Coast (US);Mississippi;United States
results.title: Potentially Deadly Bacteria Detected in U.S. Soil for First Time
results.abstract: The bacteria, Burkholderia pseudomallei, was found along the Gulf Coast region of Southern Mississippi. Previously, it had been detected in parts of Asia and Australia.
org_facet: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
geo_facet: Far East, South and Southeast Asia and Pacific Areas

media.caption: The Burkholderia pseudomallei bacteria, which can cause melioidosis, a rare and sometimes deadly disease long thought to be confined to tropical climates.
media.copyright: Dr. Todd Parker/U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, via Associated Press

results.adx_keywords: Vitamin D;Osteoporosis;Bones;Bone Fractures;Preventive Medicine;Clinical Trials;Research;Cummings, Steven R;Rosen, Clifford J;New England Journal of Medicine
results.title: Study Finds Another Condition That Vitamin D Pills Do Not Help
results.abstract: The vitamin pills do not prevent bone fractures in most people or protect against many other diseases, adding to questions about medical guidance many now take for granted.

media.caption: A study of nearly 26,000 people who were assigned to take vitamin D each day found the vitamin had no effect, even among people who had low vitamin D levels or osteoporosis.

results.title: Spelling Bee Forum
results.abstract: Feeling stuck on today’s puzzle? We can help.

results.title: On My 100th Birthday, Reflections on Archie Bunker and Donald Trump
results.abstract: The Emmy-winning TV producer Norman Lear considers his first century and his hopes for the next century.

media.caption: Carroll O’Connor, who played Archie Bunker, in 1971.

results.adx_keywords: Doctors;Abortion;States (US);Pregnancy and Childbirth;Sex Crimes;Law and Legislation;Roe v Wade (Supreme Court Decision);Attorneys General;Bernard, Caitlin;Indiana
results.byline: By Sheryl Gay Stolberg and Ava Sasani
results.title: An Indiana Doctor Speaks Out on Abortion, and Pays a Price
results.abstract: Dr. Caitlin Bernard, who provided an abortion to a 10-year-old, says doctors shouldn’t be silent. But she finds herself at the center of a post-Roe clash shaking the medical community.

media.caption: Dr. Caitlin Bernard, an Indianapolis obstetrician-gynecologist, gained national attention for providing abortion care to a 10-year-old rape victim.
media.copyright: Amanda Andrade-Rhoades for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Oceans and Seas;Fish and Other Marine Life;Exploration and Explorers;Science and Technology;Earth;National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration;Atlantic Ocean;Azores Islands
results.title: There Are Holes on the Ocean Floor. Scientists Don’t Know Why.
results.abstract: Similar openings on the sea floor were first spotted 18 years ago along the Mid-Atlantic Ridge. Their origins remain unknown. Scientists are asking the public for their thoughts.

media.caption: While researchers explored a volcano in the Mid-Atlantic Ridge on July 23, they observed several sets of holes in the sediment that remain a mystery to scientists.

results.adx_keywords: United States Politics and Government;Television;Trump, Donald J;Fox News Channel
results.title: Fox News snubbed Trump’s speech, in what’s becoming a pattern.
results.abstract: The network devoted little airtime to the speech on Tuesday by a former president its hosts often defend. Notably, it did go live with Mike Pence’s address.

media.caption: Former President Donald J. Trump gave the keynote speech at the America First Policy Institute Summit on Tuesday, but Fox News did not broadcast it live.

results.title: The Default Tech Settings You Should Turn Off Right Away
results.abstract: These controls, which are buried inside products from Apple, Google, Meta and others, make us share more data than we need to.

results.adx_keywords: United States Politics and Government;Law and Legislation;Inflation (Economics);Manchin, Joe III;Schumer, Charles E;Sinema, Kyrsten;Democratic Party;Senate
results.byline: By Emily Cochrane and Annie Karni
results.title: After Clash, Manchin and Schumer Rushed to Reset Climate and Tax Deal
results.abstract: The West Virginia Democrat said he had relented and agreed to sign on to a climate, energy and tax package after returning to negotiations to draft a version that would combat inflation.

media.caption: Senator Joe Manchin III of West Virginia had been the chief Democratic holdout on the climate, energy and tax package, the centerpiece of President Biden’s domestic policy plan.

results.adx_keywords: Law and Legislation;Global Warming;Alternative and Renewable Energy;Federal Taxes (US);United States Economy;United States Politics and Government;Health Insurance and Managed Care;Drugs (Pharmaceuticals);Inflation (Economics);Manchin, Joe III;Biden, Joseph R Jr;Senate;Democratic Party
results.byline: By Emily Cochrane, Jim Tankersley and Lisa Friedman
results.title: Manchin, in Reversal, Agrees to Quick Action on Climate and Tax Plan
results.abstract: The West Virginia Democrat, a holdout on his party’s domestic agenda, said the package would reduce inflation, a concern he had cited in rejecting it just weeks ago.

media.caption: “Rather than risking more inflation with trillions in new spending, this bill will cut the inflation taxes Americans are paying,” Senator Joe Manchin III said in a statement on Wednesday.
media.copyright: Pete Marovich for The New York Times

results.byline: By Noah Weiland and Sharon LaFraniere
results.title: Biden Administration Plans to Offer Updated Booster Shots in September
results.abstract: With reformulated shots from Pfizer and Moderna on the horizon, the F.D.A. has decided that Americans under 50 should wait to receive second boosters.
org_facet: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

media.caption: The new versions are expected to perform better against the now-dominant Omicron subvariant BA.5, although the data available so far is still preliminary.
media.copyright: Erika P. Rodriguez for The New York Times

results.title: Los Angeles Enjoys Its New Bridge a Little Too Much

results.title: Why Do I Sweat So Much in My Sleep?
results.abstract: There are many possible reasons you might wake up in a pool of perspiration. Here’s how to tell when it should be cause for concern.

results.title: How to Live With Covid When You Are Tired of Living With Covid

results.title: He Built a Home to Survive a Civil War. Tragedy Found Him Anyway.

results.byline: By Lisa Friedman and Brad Plumer
results.title: Surprise Deal Would Be Most Ambitious Climate Action Undertaken by U.S.
results.abstract: The announcement Wednesday of an agreement in the Senate almost instantly reset the role of the United States in the global effort to fight climate change.

media.caption: The climate legislation’s most immediate effect will be to supercharge the growth of wind and other clean energy industries in the United States, experts said.

results.adx_keywords: Animal Abuse, Rights and Welfare;Dogs;Research;Breeding of Animals;Humane Society of the United States;United States;Virginia
results.byline: By April Rubin and Jesus Jiménez
results.title: 4,000 Mistreated Beagles Need Homes. These Folks Are Stepping Up.
results.abstract: The dogs were headed for testing labs and didn’t even have names or know how to play. Volunteers are introducing them to grassy yards and cuddly movie nights for the first time.
org_facet: Humane Society of the United States

media.caption: “Everything, from the way that grass feels to watching cars drive by, it’s all going to be a brand-new experience for them,” said Lindsay Hamrick of the Humane Society of the United States.

results.title: Tony Dow, Big Brother Wally on ‘Leave It to Beaver,’ Dies at 77
results.abstract: He was later a director, producer and sculptor, but he never shook his association with the sitcom. His death came a day after it was announced erroneously.

media.caption: Tony Dow in the late 1950s, when he and Jerry Mathers played siblings on the popular suburban sitcom “Leave It to Beaver.”

results.byline: By Jesus Jiménez and April Rubin
results.title: 8 Dead as Flash Flooding Swamps Parts of Kentucky
results.abstract: The National Guard was mobilizing to rescue people from homes and rooftops in what Kentucky’s governor said was one of the “most devastating flooding events” in state history.

results.adx_keywords: Antitrust Laws and Competition Issues;Airlines and Airplanes;Mergers, Acquisitions and Divestitures;Travel and Vacations;Regulation and Deregulation of Industry;Frontier Airlines Inc;JetBlue Airways Corporation;Spirit Airlines
results.title: JetBlue and Spirit announce plan to merge, creating fifth-largest U.S. airline.
results.abstract: The deal, which values Spirit at $3.8 billion, was announced a day after Frontier’s bid for Spirit fell apart. It is likely to face antitrust scrutiny.

media.caption: A merger of JetBlue Airways and Spirit Airlines would create an airline based in New York and led by JetBlue’s chief executive.
